subsc: Other social services,Sub-national government administration,Health,Central government administration
trustfund:
TF040808-GAMBIA: HIV AIDS RAPID RESPONSE,TF040601-GAMBIA INNOVATIVE AIDS
            PREVENTION STRATEGY

abstracts.cdata!:
The human immuno-deficiency virus (HIV)
            / acquired immuno-deficiency syndrome (AIDS) Rapid Response
            Project for the Gambia is within the context of the
            Multi-Country HIV/AIDs Program for the Africa Region and
            strives to assist the Government of the Gambia to stem a
            rapid growth of HIV/AIDs through a) maintaining the current
            low epidemic levels; b) reducing its spread and mitigating
            its effects; and c) increasing access to prevention services
            as well as care and support for those infected and affected.
            The project consists of four components. The first, capacity
            building and policy development, will support the National
            HIV/Aids Council as well as addressing a national strategy
            and action plan; project coordination and administration;
            and advocacy, training, monitoring, evaluation, and
            technical support activities. The second, multi-sectoral
            responses to prevention and care, will improve the capacity
            of non-health sector line departments to respond to the
            epidemic. The third component, health sector responses to
            Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs) and HIV/AIDs
            management, will provide resources to the sector for
            management manuals and other activities, including
            enhancement of the blood supply system and acquiring access
            to antiretroviral (ARV) therapy as well as general
            prevention and care. The fourth component, community and
            civil service initiatives, will provide grant resources to
            eligible applicants.
